results.title: Rearing dairy calves
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian Government Film Unit and Don Anderson
results.brief_description: Correct methods for rearing calves. Stresses individual feeding from buckets. To prevent digestive troubles and worm infestation, paddocks must be rotated. Calves must be drenched to prevent worms and if necessary vaccinated for black leg. Adequate clean and draught-proof shelter must be provided. Procedure for dehorning calves is also shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tasmanian Government Film Unit and Don Anderson

results.title: Rear window [DVD]
results.brief_description: A freelance travelling news photographer with a broken leg is confined in his Greenwich Village apartment during a New York heatwave. A voyeuristic impulse leads him from curiosity to suspicion of murder as he observes his neighbours in the apartments opposite. His morbid curiosity is marked by a switch from binoculars to a telephoto lens as he watches a ‘silent’ film of other people’s lives. To Hitchcock it was the visual construction of a mental process, ‘the epitome of the subjective treatment’. Cast includes James Stewart, Grace Kelly, Wendell Corey, Thelma Ritter. Screenplay by John Michael Hayes based on a the short story by Cornell Woolrich. Photography by Robert Burks. Music by Franz Waxman.

results.title: Reap the wild wind
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures and Cecil B. DeMille
results.brief_description: Shipwreck on the Reef, Shipwreck on the Reef, this was the cry the local shipowners and salvage operators in Key West during the 1840’s awaited. Their business thrived on the cargo of wrecked ships but are all the wrecks caused by nature or man made? Why is it that King Cutler (Raymond Massey) always seemed to be the first on the scene? These and other questions are asked by local ship owner Loxi Claiborne (Paulette Goddard) and others. Meanwhile Loxi’s suitor Captain Jack Stuart (John Wayne) is suspected by the jealous lawyer Steve Tolliver (Ray Milland). Who will win in the romance stakes? The star studded cast includes Robert Preston, Susan Heywood, Charles Bickford, Walter Hampden and Janet Beecher. This Cecil B. DeMille production of piracy, hot-blooded love and huge clipper ships gliding in the mist won an Academy Award for its Special Effects and was based on a Saturday Evening Post story by Thelma Strabel.

results.title: Realms of the Russian bear
results.brief_description: From the Volga Delta to the mighty Russian Far East, from huge smoking volcanoes to cold icy coasts, take an incredible journey of exploration into the wildlife and countryside of one of the world’s most remarkable areas. Wildfowl and water birds, leopards and tigers, wild asses and Polar Bears - all are here amongst the amazing variety of creatures befitting this huge, little explored area. Presented by Russian naturalist Nikolai Drozdov, this spectacular award-winning BBC series is a visual feast for all nature lovers.

results.title: Realms of light: the baroque
results.creator_credit: Eugene Marner, Carole Lucia Satrina and Educational Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Art of the western world”.
An episode in the comprehensive art history series, “Art of the Western World”, that focuses on art work from the commissions arising from the church’s campaign against the Reformation to works commissioned by the Royal and wealthy of Europe in the 17th century. Narrated by Michael Wood, this program focuses on dramatic depictions of religious scenes in the work of Caravaggio and Bernini as well as the work of such artists as Velazquez and Rembrandt. Through a discussion of the works in their historical, religious, intellectual and social context this program provides both a thorough outline of these periods in art history and underlines their relevance to issues outside the parameters of the works themselves.

results.title: Realm of the wild
results.creator_credit: United States. Forest Service and Carl Stearns Clancy
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates the work of the National Forest Service in the USA in preserving wild game. The film was shot entirely in National parks and reserves, and has many beautiful sequences showing the birds and animals in their natural surroundings. The Canada goose, ducks, owls, Canada jays, sage hens, squirrels, moose, deer, buffaloes, elk, mountain goats, sheep, ptarmigan, and many animals and birds are observed.

results.title: Reality therapy and discipline at home
results.creator_credit: Institute of Reality Therapy, Educator Training Centre
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Help for parents”.
Designed to provide ideas for developing parenting skills to help young people evaluate their behaviour and to plan more acceptable alternatives. Dr William Glasser interviews Tom McGuiness presenting the basic practices used in the Parent Involvement Program at the Institute of Reality Therapy, Educator Training Centre in Los Angeles. Demonstrates how each step is applied in the parent-child relationship.
